availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Mullins (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Calloway Mullins and Mary Mullins. Married to Sarah Ann Singleton Mullins in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in April 1862. Father of Mary M. Mullins and John G. Mullins. Attended school in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Rockcastle County in 1860. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 145B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 568.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 4, p. 64B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Rockcastle County, KY, July 1863, p. 245.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Rockcastle County Marriages, Film 000806409.
"James Henry Mullins (1834-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 7002278, accessed October 13, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7002278.
